code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken¶

Generic Backend

Silvio Weging 2024

Contains: Calls to the API Token model

Attributes¶

logger

Functions¶

checkIfAPITokenExists(→ str | Exception)

Checks if there already is a token and if so, return it

createAPIToken(→ str | Exception)

Generate an API Token for User/Organization if there is none yet

checkAPITokenAndRetrieveUserObject(token)

Check if API Token is legit and if so, return either the user or the orga

deleteAPIToken(token)

Deletes the API token for that user/orga

Module Contents¶

code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken.logger¶
code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken.checkIfAPITokenExists(session) → str | Exception¶

Checks if there already is a token and if so, return it

Parameters:

session – The session

Returns:

Token if it exists, empty string if not

Return type:

str | Exception

code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken.createAPIToken(session) → str | Exception¶

Generate an API Token for User/Organization if there is none yet

Parameters:

session – The session

Returns:

The token string or Exception

Return type:

str | Exception

code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken.checkAPITokenAndRetrieveUserObject(token: str)¶

Check if API Token is legit and if so, return either the user or the orga

Parameters:

token (str) – The API token

Returns:

(False, None, False) if there is nothing, (False, User, False) if a user is associated with that token, else (True, Organization, False). The last one is only true if the user/orga is an admin.

Return type:

(bool, None | User | Organization, bool)

code_General.connections.postgresql.pgAPIToken.deleteAPIToken(token: str)¶

Deletes the API token for that user/orga

Parameters:

token (str) – The API token

Returns:

None or Exception if it didn’t work

Return type:

None | Exception
